medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 2 days prior to admission with diplopia, along with nausea and vomiting, mild headache, and a sensation of unsteadiness. The diplopia resolved upon closing the right eye. The next day, he remained in bed experiencing fatigue and light-headedness when standing, with persistent nausea. On the day of admission, he noted weakness and clumsiness of his left hand.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of granulomatosis with polyangiitis, chronic renal insufficiency, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, coronary artery disease, remote history of steatohepatitis, bilateral inguinal herniorrhaphies, and laminectomies and lateral fusion between the third and sixth vertebrae of the cervical spine.
medical_history.social_history: Married and retired, drinks alcohol in moderation, has a smoking history of 40 pack-years (quit 5 years earlier), and does not use illicit drugs.
